millsfield:images_texts:
Regional Wines
Guenoc
Guenoc, 1993, North Coast Chardonnay
The Guenoc label carries a portrait of the actress
Lillie Langtry who owned the estate and made wines
there during the last century. These days the wines are
among the most modern in California, combining top
quality fruit with the latest in winemaking expertise.
The result is this archetypal Chardonnay which
manages to integrate crisp fruit flavours with
buttery, apple nuances and the added texture
and depth of new oak maturation.
HAHN
Hahn Estates, 1990, Cabernet Sauvignon
This outstanding Cabernet Sauvignon is made from
fruit sourced from the beautiful Santa Lucia highlands
in the Monterey district to the south of San Francisco.
The 1990 vintage is considered to be the greatest
recent red wine vintage giving concentrated, rich wines
which are surprisingly approachable now. This wine
exhibits spicy, tobacco aromas together with
concentrated plummy fruit, a wonderful
match for all meat dishes and cheeses.
RA ORZA DALY CWOR
10 16JU1.95 221C002-B95
European White Wines
Today's flight will feature one of the following
European white wines for your enjoyment.
LOUIS MAX
bontagny
Montagny, 1993, Louis Max
The appellation of Montagny is situated at the
southern extreme of the Côte Chalonnaise in Burgundy
and is an excellent source of high quality Chardonnay
based wines. This example from Louis Max is a perfect
airline wine. It has sufficient weight of ripe fruit to
cope with the effects of the pressurized cabin on the
palate. The wine has concentrated citrus and honey oak
aromas as well as an attractive, rich, citrus fruit flavour
with an oak complexity and a fine texture.
POUILLY-FUISSÉ
Pouilly-Fuissé, 1993, Louis de Saint Bonnet
Pouilly-Fuissé is the best known commune of the
Mâconnais region in the south of Burgundy. It should
not be confused with the wines of Pouilly-Fumé,
a similar sounding village situated in the central
vineyards of the Loire, making fine Sauvignon Blanc.
Pouilly-Fuissé is made from 100% Chardonnay grapes.
Its fine balance between fruit and acidity is the result
of a combination of limestone soil and sunny slopes.
This wine is particularly delicious with seafood.
BA USLA DAILY CW OL
16JUL.95 221C002-B95 1
